acceptedAnswer.text: License-Token is an innovative model that integrates a financial system with traditional open-source licensing to address sustainability challenges in open-source software (OSS).
It introduces a digital asset model that functions as both a license and a currency, allowing the formalization of contributions and usage rights in OSS.

mainEntity.name: What are the benefits of using License-Token in OSS?

acceptedAnswer.text: License-Token provides sustainable funding, enhances contribution incentives, and decentralizes governance in open-source projects.
The challenges include potential commercialization concerns and technical overheads.

mainEntity.name: What are the future implications of License-Token?

acceptedAnswer.text: As blockchain technologies advance, License-Token is expected to better integrate with open-source projects, enhancing financial models while aligning with regulatory frameworks.

mainEntity.name: Where can I learn more about open-source concepts and digital asset compliance?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can explore more about open-source concepts at [Open Source Concepts](https://opensource.guide) and understand digital asset compliance through [Digital Asset Compliance](https://cointelegraph.com).

mainEntity.name: What resources are available for understanding blockchain's role in open-source?

acceptedAnswer.text: For insights into blockchain and open-source, visit [Blockchain and Open Source](https://news.bitcoin.com); for regulatory contexts, see [Current Regulations](https://www.sec.gov).
